# Documentation Guidelines

## Documentation Philosophy
- Documentation should be clear, concise, and up-to-date
- Write documentation for your future self and team members
- Focus on why something was built, not just how it works
- Keep documentation close to the code it describes

## Code Documentation

### TypeScript/JavaScript
- Use JSDoc comments for public APIs and complex functions
- Include parameter types, return types, and usage examples
- Document any non-obvious business logic or algorithms
- Explain the purpose and context of utility functions

### Astro Components
- Document component props, their types, and default values
- Explain component usage and integration patterns
- Document any client-side interactivity or hydration requirements
- Include examples of component usage in different contexts

### Content Collections
- Document schema definitions and field purposes
- Explain content structure and organization
- Provide examples of frontmatter usage
- Document any content transformation or processing logic

## Project Documentation

### README Files
- Keep the main README focused on project overview and getting started
- Include clear installation and development instructions
- Document available scripts and their purposes
- Explain the project structure and key concepts

### Architecture Documentation
- Document major architectural decisions and trade-offs
- Explain the content management strategy
- Document build and deployment processes
- Include diagrams for complex interactions when helpful

### API Documentation
- Document any API routes and their expected inputs/outputs
- Include authentication and error handling information
- Provide example requests and responses
- Document rate limiting and usage guidelines

## Content Documentation

### Markdown Content
- Use clear headings and proper markdown structure
- Include meta descriptions and SEO-relevant information
- Use consistent formatting and style
- Ensure all links and references are valid

### Content Guidelines
- Document content creation and editing processes
- Explain frontmatter requirements and options
- Provide style guides for consistent tone and voice
- Document image optimization and usage guidelines

## Documentation Maintenance
- Review and update documentation during code changes
- Remove outdated information promptly
- Ensure examples and code snippets remain functional
- Version documentation alongside code releases

## Documentation Tools
- Use markdown for most documentation
- Include code examples that can be tested
- Use consistent formatting and structure
- Link between related documentation sections

## Quality Standards
- Write in clear, professional language appropriate for financial services
- Use proper grammar and spelling
- Ensure accessibility in documentation formatting
- Make documentation scannable with headers and lists
